project_metadata.name: LocalServiceHub
project_metadata.objective: A community-driven directory that parses 'service-list.csv' to provide a searchable and filterable interface for local neighborhood services.

fields.name: Category
fields.description: Type of service (e.g., Food, Plumbing, Health, Homestay)

fields.name: Service Provider/Name
fields.description: The name of the business or individual provider

fields.name: Contact Number
fields.description: Phone number(s), may include multiple entries

fields.name: Notes/Location
fields.description: Specific neighborhood details, availability, or extra services

data_handling.description: Parse the CSV on initial load. Filter out rows where 'Service Provider/Name' is empty. Handle nulls in 'Notes/Location' gracefully by displaying 'N/A' or hiding the field.

filtering_logic.text_search: Search across 'Service Provider/Name', 'Category', and 'Notes/Location' using a single input.
filtering_logic.category_pills: Dynamically generate filter buttons/pills based on unique values in the 'Category' column.
filtering_logic.multi_select: Allow users to select one or more categories to narrow down results.

ui_components.card_layout: Display each service in a card showing the Category as a badge, the Name in bold, and a 'Call' button that uses the tel: link protocol.
ui_components.stats_bar: Show a count of how many services are currently visible versus the total.

development_steps.task: Setup Next.js project with Tailwind and upload 'service-list.csv' to the public folder.
Create a 'useServices' custom hook to parse the CSV into a typed JSON array.
Build the layout: A top search bar, a horizontal scrolling category list, and a responsive grid for service cards.
Implement filtering logic using useMemo to ensure performance as the list grows (100+ items).

ux_constraints.mobile_first: Must be highly usable on mobile for quick 'on-the-go' contact.
ux_constraints.direct_action: The phone number should be a clickable link for immediate dialing.
